title: Working with Badges
text: Badges cardargus inspired shields.io consist label-value pair customizable colors.

title: Working with Badges
code: library(cardargus)  # Basic badge badge <- create_badge(   label = "Status",   value = "Active",   color = "#4CAF50" )  # Save to file writeLines(badge, "status_badge.svg")

title: Working with Badges
text: right side badge uses specified color. left side always gray (#555):
code: # Green for success badge_success <- create_badge("Build", "Passing", "#4CAF50")  # Red for failure badge_error <- create_badge("Build", "Failing", "#e74c3c")  # Blue for information badge_info <- create_badge("Version", "1.0.0", "#3498db")  # Orange for warning badge_warning <- create_badge("Coverage", "45%", "#fab255")  # White (default) badge_default <- create_badge("License", "MIT", "white")

title: Working with Badges
text: badge automatically adjusts text color based background brightness:
code: # Dark background -> white text create_badge("Test", "Dark", "#2c3e50")  # Light background -> dark text create_badge("Test", "Light", "#f1c40f")

title: Working with Badges
text: Create multiple badges horizontal row:
code: badges <- list(   list(label = "Units", value = "192"),   list(label = "Budget", value = "$36.4M"),   list(label = "Status", value = "Active", color = "#4CAF50") )  # All badges will have uniform height row <- create_badge_row(badges, default_color = "white", uniform_height = TRUE)

title: Working with Badges
text: Badges automatically positioned top cards:
code: card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   badges_data = list(     list(label = "Units", value = "500", color = "white"),     list(label = "Budget", value = "$50M", color = "#4CAF50"),     list(label = "Phase", value = "2/3", color = "#3498db")   ),   fields = list(...),   bg_color = "#fab255" )

title: Working with Badges
text: using create_badge_row() cards, badges automatically height visual consistency:
code: # These badges will all have the same height badges <- list(   list(label = "A", value = "1"),              # Short   list(label = "Long Label", value = "Value"), # Long   list(label = "X", value = "Y")               # Short )  row <- create_badge_row(badges, uniform_height = TRUE)

title: Working with Badges
code: badge <- create_badge(   label = "Custom",   value = "Badge",   color = "#9b59b6",   font = "Roboto",          # Custom font   fontsize = 12,            # Font size   style = "margin: 5px;"    # Additional CSS )

title: Working with Badges
code: # Single badge badge <- create_badge("Version", "1.0.0", "#3498db") writeLines(badge, "version.svg")  # Badge row row <- create_badge_row(badges) writeLines(row, "badges.svg")

title: Working with Badges
code: # Display inline badge <- create_badge("Status", "Active", "#4CAF50") knitr::asis_output(badge)

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: cardargus R package creating informative cards SVG format. Cards self-contained, styles, fonts, graphic elements embedded SVG file .

title: Introduction to cardargus
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("castlab/cardargus") library(cardargus)

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: simplest way create card using svg_card() function:
code: library(cardargus)  card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   badges_data = list(     list(label = "Units", value = "192", color = "white"),     list(label = "Budget", value = "$5.2M", color = "white"),     list(label = "Status", value = "Active", color = "#4CAF50")   ),   fields = list(     list(       list(label = "Project Name", value = "Downtown Housing", with_icon = TRUE)     ),     list(       list(label = "Address", value = "123 Main Street, City Center")     ),     list(       list(label = "City", value = "New York"),       list(label = "State", value = "NY")     ),     list(       list(label = "Developer", value = "ABC Construction"),       list(label = "Owner", value = "City Housing Authority")     )   ),   bg_color = "#3498db",   width = 500,   footer = "Source: Housing Department - January 2026" )

what: Displaying cards in R Markdown / Quarto
title: Introduction to cardargus
text: Use include_card() display cards inline documents: chunk-based workflow, register cardargus engine:
code: # Display card as SVG (best quality) include_card(card)  # Display card as PNG (better compatibility) include_card_png(card, dpi = 150) # In setup chunk register_cardargus_knitr()  # Then use cardargus chunks: # ```{cardargus} # svg_card(title = "My Card", ...) # ```

title: Introduction to cardargus
code: save_svg(card, "my_card.svg")

title: Introduction to cardargus
code: # Standard conversion (uses rsvg) svg_to_png(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)  # Chrome-based conversion (best font rendering) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)  # PNG with white background svg_to_png(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300, background = "white")

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: perfect font rendering Google Fonts, use headless Chrome: Install chromote Chrome support: install.packages("chromote")
code: # Check if Chrome is available chrome_available()  # PNG with Chrome (best quality) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)  # Vector PDF with Chrome svg_to_pdf_chrome(card, "my_card.pdf")  # In R Markdown / Quarto include_card_png(card, dpi = 300, engine = "chrome")

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: package includes several SVG logos ready use:
code: # List available logos list_bundled_svgs()  # Use in a card card <- svg_card(   title = "FAR",   badges_data = list(...),   fields = list(...),   bg_color = "#fab255",   logos = c(get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg"), get_svg_path("seduh.svg")),   logos_height = 40,   bottom_logos = c(get_svg_path("gov_pe3.svg")),   bottom_logos_height = 35 )

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: control, use svg_card() directly options:
code: # Define badges badges <- list(   list(label = "Units", value = "500", color = "white"),   list(label = "Investment", value = "$50M", color = "#4CAF50") )  # Define fields with custom icons fields <- list(   list(     list(label = "Project", value = "Housing Development",           with_icon = icon_building())  # Or use a file path: "/path/to/icon.svg"   ),   list(     list(label = "City", value = "Boston"),     list(label = "State", value = "MA")   ),   list(     list(label = "Start", value = "Jan/2024"),     list(label = "End", value = "Dec/2025"),     list(label = "Progress", value = "45%")   ) )  # Create card card <- svg_card(   title = "HOUSING",   badges_data = badges,   fields = fields,   bg_color = "#2c3e50",   title_color = "#ecf0f1",   width = 500 )

title: Introduction to cardargus
text: Customizing Cards - Colors, fonts, styles Working Badges - Shields.io-style badges Icons Logos - Using custom icons Font Management - Google Fonts integration Export Conversion - PNG, PDF, batch processing

title: Customizing Cards
code: library(cardargus)  # Orange card card_orange <- svg_card(title = "ALERT", bg_color = "#fab255", ...)  # Blue card card_blue <- svg_card(title = "INFO", bg_color = "#3498db", ...)   # Green card card_green <- svg_card(title = "SUCCESS", bg_color = "#2ecc71", ...)  # Red card card_red <- svg_card(title = "URGENT", bg_color = "#e74c3c", ...)  # Dark card card_dark <- svg_card(title = "PREMIUM", bg_color = "#2c3e50", ...)

title: Customizing Cards
text: can use CSS-style linear gradients instead solid colors: Supported gradient directions: right - horizontal, left right left - horizontal, right left bottom - vertical, top bottom (default) top - vertical, bottom top 45deg, 90deg, 135deg, etc. - angle-based directions
code: # Horizontal gradient (left to right) card <- svg_card(   title = "HOUSING",   bg_color = "linear-gradient(to right, #1a5a3a, #2e7d32)",   ... )  # Diagonal gradient (135 degrees) card <- svg_card(   title = "PROGRAM",    bg_color = "linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea, #764ba2)",   ... )  # Vertical gradient (top to bottom) card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   bg_color = "linear-gradient(to bottom, #00c6ff, #0072ff)",   ... )  # Multi-color gradient card <- svg_card(   title = "RAINBOW",   bg_color = "linear-gradient(to right, #ff6b6b, #feca57, #48dbfb)",   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: card <- svg_card(   title = "MY CARD",   title_color = "#FFD700",      # Gold title   label_color = "#E0E0E0",      # Light gray labels   footer_color = "white",       # White footer   value_text_color = "#212529", # Dark gray values   value_bg_color = "#f8f8ff",   # Field background   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
text: cardargus uses Google Fonts default. default font â€œJostâ€, can use Google Font:
code: # Using Roboto card <- svg_card(   title = "CARD",   font = "Roboto",   ... )  # Using Open Sans card <- svg_card(   title = "CARD",   font = "Open Sans",   ... )  # Using Montserrat card <- svg_card(   title = "CARD",   font = "Montserrat",   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: card <- svg_card(   title = "CARD",   title_fontsize = 32,    # Larger title   label_fontsize = 12,    # Labels   value_fontsize = 11,    # Values   footer_fontsize = 8,    # Footer   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: # Narrow card card_narrow <- svg_card(width = 400, ...)  # Default card card_default <- svg_card(width = 500, ...)  # Wide card card_wide <- svg_card(width = 600, ...)

title: Customizing Cards
code: card <- svg_card(   padding = 25,         # Internal padding   corner_radius = 12,   # More rounded corners   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: # With automatic timestamp card <- svg_card(   footer = NULL,  # Uses automatic timestamp   ... )  # With custom text card <- svg_card(   footer = "Source: Housing Dept. - Updated January 2026",   ... )  # Without footer card <- svg_card(   footer = "",   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: # Without logos card <- svg_card(   logos = list(),   ... )  # With file paths card <- svg_card(   logos = c("path/to/logo1.svg", "path/to/logo2.svg"),   logos_height = 40,   ... )  # With bundled logos card <- svg_card(   logos = c(get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg")),   logos_height = 40,   bottom_logos = c(get_svg_path("gov_pe3.svg")),   bottom_logos_height = 35,   ... )

title: Customizing Cards
code: card <- svg_card(   title = "HOUSING PROGRAM",   badges_data = list(     list(label = "Units", value = "1,000", color = "white"),     list(label = "Investment", value = "$100M", color = "#4CAF50")   ),   fields = list(     list(list(label = "Project", value = "Downtown Development", with_icon = TRUE)),     list(       list(label = "City", value = "Boston"),       list(label = "State", value = "MA")     )   ),   bg_color = "#2c3e50",   width = 550,   padding = 25,   corner_radius = 12,   font = "Roboto",   title_fontsize = 24,   title_color = "#ecf0f1",   label_color = "#bdc3c7",   footer = "Real-time updated data",   footer_color = "#95a5a6" )

title: Customizing Cards
code: # In R Markdown or Quarto include_card(card)  # Or as PNG for better compatibility include_card_png(card, dpi = 150)

title: Export and Conversion
text: cardargus provides two rendering engines converting SVG PNG/PDF:

title: Export and Conversion
text: simplest way save card:
code: library(cardargus)  card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   badges_data = list(list(label = "Status", value = "Active")),   fields = list(list(list(label = "Name", value = "Test"))),   bg_color = "#3498db" )  # Save to file (with embedded fonts) save_svg(card, "my_card.svg")

title: Export and Conversion
text: Uses librsvg/ImageMagick. Fast reliable, requires fonts embedded SVG:
code: # Convert SVG string to PNG svg_to_png(card, "my_card.png")  # With custom DPI (default is 300) svg_to_png(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)

title: Export and Conversion
text: Uses headless Chrome via chromote package. Provides perfect font rendering, including Google Fonts loaded via @import:
code: # Check if Chrome is available if (chrome_available()) {   # High-quality PNG with Chrome   svg_to_png_chrome(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300) }  # Convert to PDF (vector output) svg_to_pdf_chrome(card, "my_card.pdf")

previous_headings: Converting to PNG > Chrome-based conversion (recommended for fonts)
title: Export and Conversion
code: # Install chromote package install.packages("chromote")  # Check if Chrome is available chrome_available()  # If Chrome is not installed, download it automatically ensure_chrome(download = TRUE)  # This downloads "Chrome for Testing" (~150MB) to your user cache # No admin/root permissions required!

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Transparent background (preserves rounded corners) svg_to_png(card, "card_transparent.png", dpi = 300)  # White background svg_to_png(card, "card_white.png", dpi = 300, background = "white")  # Chrome also supports backgrounds svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card_white.png", dpi = 300, background = "white")

title: Export and Conversion
text: Add margin around card:
code: # Add 20px margin with white background svg_to_png_with_margin(   card,   output_path = "card_with_margin.png",   margin = 20,   background = "white",   dpi = 300 )

title: Export and Conversion
text: Export multiple formats :
code: # Export to SVG and PNG svg_to_formats(   card,   output_base = "exports/my_card",  # Without extension   formats = c("svg", "png"),   dpi = 300 ) # Creates: exports/my_card.svg, exports/my_card.png

title: Export and Conversion
text: Convert multiple cards efficiently:
code: # Create multiple cards cards <- list(   svg_card(title = "Card 1", badges_data = list(), fields = list()),   svg_card(title = "Card 2", badges_data = list(), fields = list()),   svg_card(title = "Card 3", badges_data = list(), fields = list()) )  # Batch convert to PNG batch_svg_to_png(   svg_list = cards,   output_dir = "output/cards",   prefix = "card",   dpi = 300,   background = "white" ) # Creates: output/cards/card_001.png, card_002.png, card_003.png

title: Export and Conversion
text: knitr functions support engine parameter: "auto" (default): Uses Chrome available, otherwise rsvg "chrome": Forces Chrome (errors unavailable) "rsvg": Forces rsvg/magick

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Display card directly in document (HTML only) include_card(card)  # With custom width include_card(card, width = "80%")

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Display as PNG with auto engine selection include_card_png(card, dpi = 150)  # Force Chrome for best font rendering include_card_png(card, dpi = 300, engine = "chrome")  # Force rsvg (faster, no Chrome dependency) include_card_png(card, dpi = 300, engine = "rsvg")

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Save and get path for knitr::include_graphics path <- save_card_for_knitr(   card,    filename = "my_card",    format = "png",    dpi = 300,   engine = "chrome"  # or "auto", "rsvg" ) knitr::include_graphics(path)

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Register the cardargus engine register_cardargus_knitr()  # Then in a chunk with engine='cardargus': # ```{cardargus} # svg_card(title = "Dynamic Card", ...) # ```

title: Export and Conversion
text: Convert cards grobs use grid graphics:
code: library(grid)  # Convert card to grob (auto-selects best engine) grob <- card_to_grob(card, dpi = 150)  # Force Chrome rendering grob <- card_to_grob(card, dpi = 150, engine = "chrome")  # Draw in a grid viewport grid.newpage() grid.draw(grob)

title: Export and Conversion
text: Chrome uses 96 DPI base resolution. set dpi = 300, cardargus calculates scale factor: means 400Ã—300 SVG becomes 1250Ã—938 PNG 300 DPI.

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Smaller file (lower quality) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card_web.png", dpi = 96)  # Medium file (balanced) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card_standard.png", dpi = 150)  # Larger file (high quality) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card_print.png", dpi = 300)

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Same card, different engines svg_to_png(card, "card_rsvg.png", dpi = 300) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card_chrome.png", dpi = 300)  # Chrome generally produces better results for: # - Google Fonts and custom web fonts # - Complex CSS styling # - Font weights and variants

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Safe conversion with fallback convert_card <- function(card, output_path, dpi = 300) {   if (chrome_available()) {     svg_to_png_chrome(card, output_path, dpi = dpi)   } else {     message("Chrome not available, using rsvg")     svg_to_png(card, output_path, dpi = dpi)   } }  # With explicit error handling tryCatch({   svg_to_png_chrome(card, "output.png", dpi = 300)   message("Conversion successful!") }, error = function(e) {   message("Chrome conversion failed: ", e$message)   message("Falling back to rsvg...")   svg_to_png(card, "output.png", dpi = 300) })

what: Fonts not rendering correctly with rsvg
title: Export and Conversion
text: expected behavior. librsvg : Load fonts via @import url(...) Make HTTP requests web fonts Solution: Use svg_to_png_chrome() ensure fonts embedded save_svg().

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Check Chrome availability chrome_available()  # Option 1: Download Chrome for Testing automatically ensure_chrome(download = TRUE)  # Option 2: Set path to existing Chrome manually Sys.setenv(CHROMOTE_CHROME = "/path/to/chrome")  # Option 3: Find where Chrome is installed find_chrome_path()

title: Export and Conversion
text: Chrome startup overhead. batch processing, consider:
code: # For many cards, rsvg may be faster if fonts are embedded svg_to_png(card, "output.png", dpi = 300)  # Or accept the Chrome overhead for perfect rendering svg_to_png_chrome(card, "output.png", dpi = 300)

title: Export and Conversion
code: # Increase timeout for complex SVGs svg_to_png_chrome(card, "output.png", timeout = 60)  # 60 seconds

title: Font Management
text: cardargus uses Jost default font, modern sans-serif Google Fonts. article explains configure manage fonts best results.

title: Font Management
text: function: Registers Jost Montserrat Google Fonts Enables showtext auto mode Prepares system font rendering
code: library(cardargus)  # Automatically setup fonts (recommended) setup_fonts()

title: Font Management
code: # Check if a font is available font_available("Jost") font_available("Arial")  # List cached fonts list_fonts()

title: Font Management
code: # Register a specific Google Font register_google_font("Roboto") register_google_font("Open Sans") register_google_font("Lato")

title: Font Management
text: offline use better performance, download fonts local cache:
code: # Download and cache fonts install_fonts()  # Install specific fonts install_fonts(fonts = c("Jost", "Montserrat", "Roboto"))  # Check cache location font_cache_dir()

title: Font Management
code: # Use a different font in cards card <- svg_card(   title = "MY CARD",   font = "Montserrat",  # Use Montserrat instead of Jost   ... )

title: Font Management
text: cardargus embeds fonts via Google Fonts CSS SVGs:
code: # Generate CSS for a font css <- get_font_css("Jost") cat(css) # @import url("https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Jost:wght@400;500;600;700&display=swap");  # Multiple weights css <- get_font_css("Montserrat", weights = c(400, 700))

title: Font Management
text: cardargus caches downloaded fonts user directory:
code: # Get cache directory font_cache_dir() #> "/home/user/.cache/cardargus"  # List cached fonts list_fonts()

title: Font Management
code: # SVGs directory (bundled logos) svgs_dir()  # Path to a specific SVG get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg")  # List available SVGs list_bundled_svgs()

title: Font Management
text: Run setup_fonts() creating cards Check font available: font_available("Jost") Install required packages:
code: install.packages(c("showtext", "sysfonts", "systemfonts"))

title: Font Management
text: correct font rendering PNG exports rsvg:
code: # Setup fonts first setup_fonts()  # Download fonts for embedding install_fonts()  # Create and export card <- svg_card(...) svg_to_png(card, "card.png", dpi = 300)

title: Font Management
text: perfect font rendering, use Chrome-based conversion: Chrome handles Google Fonts automatically via @import, local font installation needed.
code: # Ensure Chrome is available ensure_chrome(download = TRUE)  # Create and export card <- svg_card(...) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card.png", dpi = 300)

title: Font Management
text: servers without GUI:
code: # Option 1: Download fonts locally install_fonts()  # Update font cache (Linux) system("fc-cache -fv")  # Option 2: Use Chrome rendering (recommended) ensure_chrome(download = TRUE) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "card.png")

title: Font Management
text: full font functionality: Chrome-based rendering (recommended):
code: install.packages(c(   "showtext",      # Font rendering   "sysfonts",      # Font management   "systemfonts",   # System font detection   "gdtools"        # Text metrics )) install.packages("chromote")

title: Icons and Logos
text: cardargus includes several SVG icons common use cases:
code: library(cardargus)  # House icon (default for fields with with_icon = TRUE) icon_house(width = 50, height = 56)  # Building icon icon_building(width = 50, height = 56)  # Construction icon icon_construction(width = 50, height = 56)  # Map pin icon icon_map_pin(width = 50, height = 56)  # Money icon icon_money(width = 50, height = 56)

title: Icons and Logos
text: Icons can added fields three ways: TRUE: Uses default house icon Built-icon function: e.g., icon_building() File path: SVG file system
code: fields <- list(   # Default house icon   list(     list(label = "Project", value = "Housing Complex", with_icon = TRUE)   ),   # Built-in building icon   list(     list(label = "Building", value = "Tower A",           with_icon = icon_building())   ),   # Construction icon   list(     list(label = "Status", value = "Under Construction",          with_icon = icon_construction())   ),   # Custom SVG file path   list(     list(label = "Custom", value = "My Item",          with_icon = "/path/to/my_icon.svg")   ) )  card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   badges_data = list(),   fields = fields,   bg_color = "#3498db" )

title: Icons and Logos
text: icons accept customization parameters:
code: # Custom colors icon <- icon_house(   width = 60,   height = 70,   stroke_color = "#e74c3c",  # Red outline   stroke_width = 3,   fill = "#ffebee"           # Light red fill )  # Building with custom size building <- icon_building(   width = 40,   height = 48,   stroke_color = "#2c3e50",   fill = "#ecf0f1" )

title: Icons and Logos
text: package includes several SVG logos ready use:
code: # List all bundled SVGs list_bundled_svgs() #> [1] "gov_pe3.svg" "morar_bem.svg" "seduh.svg" "tree.svg" "example_card.svg"  # Get full path to a logo path <- get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg")  # Get the SVGs directory svgs_dir()

title: Icons and Logos
text: Logos can file paths SVG strings:
code: card <- svg_card(   title = "FAR",   badges_data = list(     list(label = "Units", value = "192", color = "white")   ),   fields = list(...),   bg_color = "#fab255",      # Top-right logos (bundled or custom paths)   logos = c(     get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg"),     get_svg_path("seduh.svg"),     "/path/to/my_custom_logo.svg"  # Any local file   ),   logos_height = 40,      # Bottom-left logos   bottom_logos = c(     get_svg_path("gov_pe3.svg")   ),   bottom_logos_height = 35 )

title: Icons and Logos
text: Use load_svg_for_embed() load resize external SVG files:
code: # Load and resize an external SVG logo_data <- load_svg_for_embed(   svg_path = "path/to/my_logo.svg",   target_height = 50 )  # The result contains: # - svg_content: The processed SVG string # - width: Calculated width (maintains aspect ratio) # - height: The target height

title: Icons and Logos
text: advanced positioning, use logo row functions:
code: # Top-right logo row logo_row <- create_logo_row(   logos = c("logo1.svg", "logo2.svg"),   target_height = 40,   spacing = 15,   card_width = 500,   x_offset = 20,   y_offset = 20 )  # Bottom-left logo row bottom_row <- create_bottom_logo_row(   logos = c("logo3.svg"),   target_height = 30,   spacing = 10,   x_offset = 20,   card_height = 400,   y_offset = 20 )

title: Icons and Logos
text: can use SVG string logo:
code: # Create a simple custom logo my_logo <- '<svg width="50" height="50" viewBox="0 0 50 50">   <circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="#3498db"/>   <text x="25" y="30" text-anchor="middle" fill="white" font-size="16">AB</text> </svg>'  # Use in a card card <- svg_card(   title = "PROJECT",   logos = list(my_logo),   logos_height = 40,   ... )

title: cardargus - SVG Cards for R
text: cardargus R package creating informative SVG cards embedded styles, Google Fonts, badges, logos. Cards self-contained SVG files, ideal dashboards, reports, visualizations.

title: cardargus - SVG Cards for R
text: Install CRAN: install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("cardargus") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("StrategicProjects/cardargus")

title: cardargus - SVG Cards for R
code: library(cardargus)  # Create an informative card card <- svg_card(   font = "Jost",   title = "FAR",      badges_data = list(     list(label = "Units",         value = "500",     color = "white"),     list(label = "Federal Grant", value = "$100M",   color = "white"),     list(label = "State Match",   value = "$80M",    color = "white")   ),      fields = list(     list(       list(label = "Project Name", value = "Boa Vista Residential",            with_icon = icon_house())     ),     list(       list(label = "Address", value = "123 Flower Street - Downtown")     ),     list(       list(label = "City",   value = "Olinda"),       list(label = "Region", value = "Pernambuco")     ),     list(       list(label = "Developer",   value = "State Government"),       list(label = "Contractor",  value = "ABC Construction"),        list(label = "Type", value = "PS")  # optional     )   ),      bg_color    = "#FF9900",   title_color = "#fff",   label_color = "#fff",   width = 450,      # You can use bundled SVGs or any local file path   logos = c(     get_svg_path("seduh.svg"),      get_svg_path("morar_bem.svg")   ),   logos_height = 40,      bottom_logos = c(     get_svg_path("tree.svg"),      get_svg_path("gov_pe.svg")   ),   bottom_logos_height = 40,      footer = paste0(     "Source: SEDUH/PE on ",      format(Sys.time(), "%Y/%m/%d at %H:%M")) ) include_card_png(card, dpi = 300, width = '50%') # Save as SVG save_svg(card, "my_card.svg")  # Convert to high-quality PNG svg_to_png(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)

what: Displaying Cards in R Markdown / Quarto
title: cardargus - SVG Cards for R
text: cardargus provides functions display cards directly documents: chunk-based workflows, register cardargus knitr engine: use cardargus chunk engine:
code: # Display card as inline SVG (best quality) include_card(card)  # Display card as PNG (better compatibility) include_card_png(card, dpi = 150)  # Save and get path for knitr::include_graphics() path <- save_card_for_knitr(card, "my_card", format = "png") knitr::include_graphics(path) # In your setup chunk register_cardargus_knitr() ```{cardargus}` svg_card(title = "My Card", ...) ```

title: cardargus - SVG Cards for R
text: perfect font rendering Google Fonts, use headless Chrome: Install chromote Chrome support:
code: # Check if Chrome is available chrome_available()  # If Chrome is not installed, download it automatically (~150MB) ensure_chrome(download = TRUE)  # Convert to PNG with Chrome (best quality) svg_to_png_chrome(card, "my_card.png", dpi = 300)  # Convert to PDF (vector output) svg_to_pdf_chrome(card, "my_card.pdf")  # In R Markdown / Quarto - force Chrome engine include_card_png(card, dpi = 300, engine = "chrome") install.packages("chromote")

what: Sanitize SVG for rasterization engines (librsvg / ImageMagick) â€” sanitize_svg_for_raster
title: Sanitize SVG for rasterization engines (librsvg / ImageMagick) â€” sanitize_svg_for_raster
text: SVGs exported editors Inkscape may contain sodipodi:* /inkscape:* nodes/attributes. namespace prefixes appear without corresponding xmlns:* declarations, strict parsers (notably librsvg) can fail errors like: helper removes non-rendering metadata blocks attributes commonly responsible parse failures, producing interoperable SVG string. also removes Google Fonts @import rules supported rasterization engines.

code: svg_card(   title = "FAR",   badges_data = list(),   fields = list(),   bg_color = "#fab255",   width = 500,   padding = 20,   corner_radius = 8,   font = "Jost",   title_fontsize = 16,   title_color = "white",   label_fontsize = 11,   value_fontsize = 11,   label_color = "white",   value_bg_color = "#f8f8ff",   value_text_color = "#212529",   show_house_icon = TRUE,   logos = list(),   logos_height = 40,   bottom_logos = list(),   bottom_logos_height = 30,   footer = NULL,   gap_to_footer = 6,   footer_row_padding_bottom = 6,   footer_fontsize = 8,   footer_color = "white",   uniform_row_height = TRUE,   show_viewer = interactive() )

title: Create an Information Card in SVG Format â€” svg_card
text: title Card title (e.g., "FAR", "FNHIS") badges_data List badge data (label, value, color) fields List field rows, row list fields label, value, optionally with_icon. with_icon parameter can : TRUE - uses default house icon FALSE NULL - icon character string - path SVG file raw SVG code bg_color Background color card. Can solid color (e.g., "#fab255") CSS gradient (e.g., "linear-gradient(right, #1a5a3a, #2e7d32)" "linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea, #764ba2)"). width Card width pixels padding Padding inside card corner_radius Corner radius rounded corners font Font family title_fontsize Title font size title_color Color card title (default "white") label_fontsize Label font size value_fontsize Value font size label_color Color field labels (default "white") value_bg_color Background color value boxes value_text_color Text color values show_house_icon Show house icon next empreendimento logos Character vector logo file paths SVG strings top right. Use get_svg_path("filename.svg") bundled logos, local path. logos_height Height top-right logos (default 40) bottom_logos Character vector logo file paths SVG strings bottom left. bottom_logos_height Height bottom-left logos (default 30) footer Footer text (e.g., update timestamp) gap_to_footer Distance (px) last info block footer row. footer_row_padding_bottom Bottom padding (px) footer row (text + logos). footer_fontsize Footer font size footer_color Color footer text (default "white") uniform_row_height TRUE, keep height inside row. show_viewer TRUE (interactive), preview SVG Viewer.

what: Convert SVG to PNG â€” svg_to_png
title: Convert SVG to PNG â€” svg_to_png
text: Convert SVG string SVG file path high-quality PNG image. function sanitizes SVG embeds required WOFF2 fonts (downloaded demand user cache) ensure consistent font rendering. Important note DPI: rsvg rasterizes primarily based pixel dimensions. make DPI matter, function scales output pixel size (dpi / 96) width / height explicitly provided.

title: Convert SVG to PNG â€” svg_to_png

title: Convert SVG to PNG â€” svg_to_png
text: svg_input SVG string path SVG file. output_path Output path PNG file (optional; temp file used NULL). width Output width pixels (NULL infer SVG scale DPI). height Output height pixels (NULL infer SVG scale DPI). dpi Resolution dots per inch (default 300 high quality). background Background color. Use "transparent" "none" transparency (default), specify color like "white", "#FFFFFF", etc.

title: Convert SVG to PNG using headless Chrome â€” svg_to_png_chrome
text: Renders SVG PNG using headless Chrome via chromote package. method provides superior font rendering compared librsvg/ImageMagick, Chrome properly handles @font-face rules, web fonts, CSS features.

title: Convert SVG to PNG using headless Chrome â€” svg_to_png_chrome

title: Convert SVG to PNG using headless Chrome â€” svg_to_png_chrome
text: svg_input SVG string path SVG file. output_path Output path PNG file. NULL, temp file used. dpi Resolution dots per inch (default 300). Chrome uses 96 DPI base, dpi = 300 results approximately 3.125x scaling. background Background color HTML page (default "transparent"). Use "white", "#FFFFFF", etc. solid background. load_wait Seconds wait page load (default 0.5). Increase fonts rendering correctly.

text: Path generated PNG file.

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2026-01-31

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: functions now follow snake_case naming convention. old function names removed.

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: Added headless Chrome support superior font rendering via chromote package. svg_to_png_chrome() - Convert SVG PNG using headless Chrome svg_to_pdf_chrome() - Convert SVG vector PDF using headless Chrome chrome_available() - Check Chrome/Chromium available ensure_chrome() - Check optionally download Chrome Testing find_chrome_path() - Find Chrome executable system

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: Chrome installed, use ensure_chrome(download = TRUE) automatically download â€œChrome Testingâ€ (~150MB). standalone Chrome distribution cached locally works without system installation.

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: user-facing messages now use cli package better formatting: - Informative error messages suggestions - Progress indicators downloads - Structured output bullets formatting

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: Made clearer can use SVG files logos icons:
code: # Use any SVG file path for logos svg_card(  title = "My Card",  logos = c("/path/to/logo1.svg", "/path/to/logo2.svg"),  ... )  # Or for icons in fields svg_card(  title = "My Card",  fields = list(    list(list(label = "Name", value = "Test", with_icon = "/path/to/icon.svg"))  ),  ... )

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: knitr/Quarto functions now support engine parameter: include_card() - Added engine parameter include_card_png() - Added engine parameter save_card_for_knitr() - Added engine parameter card_to_grob() - Added engine parameter Engine options: - "auto" (default): Uses Chrome available, otherwise rsvg - "chrome": Forces Chrome rendering - "rsvg": Forces rsvg/magick rendering

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: Fixed duplicate @font-face declarations embed_svg_fonts() Fixed double font embedding svg_to_formats() Now uses modern CSS weight range syntax (font-weight: 100 900) Removed unused inst/fonts/ directory

title: cardargus 0.2.0
text: fonts_dir() - Use font_cache_dir() instead custom_logo_svg() - Use load_svg_for_embed() pass file paths directly

title: cardargus 0.1.0
text: svg_card() - Main function creating SVG cards badges, fields, logos Support Google Fonts via embedded CSS Shields.io-style badges uniform height Top-right bottom-left logo positioning

title: cardargus 0.1.0
text: icon_house() - House/home icon icon_building() - Building icon icon_construction() - Construction icon icon_map_pin() - Location pin icon icon_money() - Money/currency icon

title: cardargus 0.1.0
text: load_svg_for_embed() - Load process external SVG files create_logo_row() - Create horizontal logo rows get_svg_path() - Get paths bundled SVGs list_bundled_svgs() - List available bundled SVGs

text: save_svg() - Save card SVG file svg_to_png() - Convert card PNG svg_to_png_with_margin() - Convert margin batch_svg_to_png() - Batch convert multiple cards
